Comment: The Dutch!
The Dutch!

Common version of the Leningrad System. Important is the bishop on g7. As for white, there exist multiple ways to respond, like 2 Bg5 or the gambits 2 g4 or 2 e4. I even saw a few matches where white decides to smash the Idea of blacks king castling to the king side by starting a pawn storm immediately.

However since I'm more used to play the english, i thought i'd try to challenge the a1 h8 diagonal.

Opening the diagonal but blocking the bishop. This leaves e6 unprotected, alongside with c7.
However although it blocks d7 for the 2nd knight, 9 ... Nc6 is possible, since i can't play d5 now.
Again a move i regularly play in my english games, not sure if it's that good vs Leningrad. Maybe d5 or Nd5 would've been better. Nd5 looks like a sweet outpost

Only at this point of the game I noticed that the weak squares at blacks side are: c7 and e6...
?? Black did not notice that e6 is weak, and so I'm free to take it and the game is already sort of gone.
